Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Regnar> It isn't necessarily "maintenance". All the exchanges are informed of hard updates to the chain weeks in advance to ensure they are all ready to update their wallets when it comes time. This isn't Komodo saying disable your wallets weeks in advance for "reasons" or anything, in fact some exchanges still have wallets open and will likely keep them open until a day or two prior. 
Exchanges manage their own risk in this way. Exchanges like Binance play it safe and will disable deposits and withdrawals likely so they can either prepare to update the tens of thousands of KMD wallets they have, or so they can consolidate funds in cold storage, update all their hot wallets, and so on. (re @Werxadler: It seems to be very important for you to tell everybody this pump is only because of the binance maintainance... We will see)

Basically a market buy (re @iqly_almond: example if you use website xchange.me you can test to put  1000kmd and see best bid, thats for  instant sell)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Regnar> Yea the API has general orderbook function but it was decided that the AtomicDEX mobile app wouldn't have it (at least not initially) the goal is more to focus on reducing bottlenecks and increasing swap successes than to add additional features. So right now the orderbook will only return the current trading pair
However one of the devs is running the market maker on his personal website and has the Orderbook API enabled so you can see what's available.
https://oracle.earth/mm2_orderbook/ (re @EPIDEMIC_media: Any way to see what offers are available without having the particular coin in wallet?)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Craig> Thanks for all the in depth responses regnar. You're a passionate guy. 
Let me try to phrase a question that's important to me. 
Take IDEX.
You visit the website and there's a funny thing you need to do, "unlocking your wallet". A few other funny things later when you want to "withdraw"
This throws off some people. But people know it's a DEX or something a little weird. So most people push on past the weirdness.
Honestly it's probably because IDEX has interesting coins that aren't listed anywhere else, not because the average user really cares about holding their keys.
 But no worries, they push on.
One big reason is they push on is because there's a list of like 100 tokens, visible on the front page, that gives their daily volume and % change in price. Also there are charts. Basically it looks like an underdesigned version of binance or another CEX.
The user then goes about his business trading with just a few quirks. Also things are slow, the website kinda lags, but it's ok because it's a DEX and a lot of coins are only possible to find there.
So the vision for atomicDEX, is it similar to that? Where a user will have to accept a few minor annoying tradeoffs in order to trade in a way roughly like a centralized exchange? 
Or is using atomicDEX going to be a radically different experience than a centralized exchange?
Another way to put it:
What tradeoffs will atomic dex accept, and what bonuses will it have besides less counterparty risk, no kycaml, your keys your coins?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Craig> Yeah I hate trading but for me it was a very easy call to sell above 1100 and buy back for 10 or 20% more KMD. I can see why that was frustrating if your coins weren't on binance. 
I don't know or care if there was manipulation. A lot of coins have pumped in 2018 or 2019 and only 3 or 4 didnt retrace at least 50% sooner or later. Even if your favorite coin partners with Google its smart to sell the news. And if there's no news in the first place, it's definitely time to sell. (re @EPIDEMIC_media: Lastly its kinda hard to sell when you can't make a deposit on your main go to exchange. So there goes your ASSumptions out the window. Im pissed off I couldnt sell at $1.05)

The user then goes about his business trading with just a few quirks. Also things are slow, the website kinda lags, but it's ok because it's a DEX and a lot of coins are only possible to find there.

We will see how it goes I guess

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <omg_gawd> Did binance open up komodo deposit ? Would explain teh damp

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if the theory that this recent price gain was due to closed deposits only, that would be the expected thing. however deposits still closed and all the prices on all the exchanges back in sync. the recent china surge is corrected and it appears so far it is little to do with deposits open or closed as the move started before the exchange wallets were closed and it seemed to follow a typical TA pattern. the rise was no steeper than the june drop in price

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there has been proof of recent china interest in KMD, so just because deposits were closed for part of the time, does not negate this fact. after a big rise, there is always a correction, if it is a natural price movement

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: of course, when deposits reopen, there could also be a bit of pent up selling that happens, but all this is on relatively low volumes overall. so it was definitely not in any pump territory, if so it would have been 1000+ BTC/day on binance alone.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Deadpool1001> No. Still closed. Kmd just went parabolic. Just a natural correction. We also hit 200 simple daily moving average. Thats a major resistance level. Also what jl777 just posted. (re @omg_gawd: Did binance open up komodo deposit ? Would explain teh damp)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the volume on the drop is significantly lower than the volume during the rise. that does not indicate any dump, rather just a few that are selling to take advantage of the steep gain in price. i think when the market mood turns a bit more bullish, we can see a continuation of the price movement that we saw recently. just starting from a higher baseline. first BTC needs to stabilize. until it does, there will be those that panic sell alts -> BTC -> fiat. because BTC could drop to $1500, at least that is their fear. however, with mining costs at near alltime highs (hashrate of 90 exahash!) any selling much below here will be at a loss for the miners

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <EPIDEMIC_media> Of course the price was going to drop before wallets were enabled, the pumpers werent going to take any chances at losing their capital to an free open market. Until somebody can show some data that shows a Chinese surge, it all sounds like a load of bollocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the proof is in the public announcement by chinese investment firm and listing on two chinese exchanges. also for the last weeks we saw a premium on the chinese exchanges relative to the others, that premium is now gone. the volumes going up was much higher than volume coming down, this indicates accumulation happened and can be seen by charting the OBV on longer timescales

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a lot of komodo was accumulated, proven by the OBV chart and since the volume is lower as the price came down, the accumulation is mostly intact

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in a pump and dump, the accumulation happens at low prices and unloaded at high prices and the on balance volume (OBV) would not be near alltime highs after it is completed
